0;35;March 16
column2: 2022;mostly-true; Make no mistake: The current spike in gas prices is largely the fault of Vladimir Putin. ;['Gas Prices'
column3: 'Foreign Policy'
column6: 'Joe Biden'];https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2022/mar/16/joe-biden/joe-biden-blame-putin-high-gasoline-prices/;" The most recent spike in gas prices has stemmed largely from Putin’s invasion of Ukraine. However
column7: gas prices were rising long before the Russian troop buildup around Ukraine became front-page news
column8: primarily from growing demand due to the economic recovery from the pandemic.

column1: 1;36;March 10, 2022;mostly-true; U.S. imports 1% of its oil from Russia while Exxon, Chevron, BP and Shell profits are at their highest level in over 7 years. ;['Energy', 'Facebook Fact-checks', 'Russia', 'Facebook posts'];https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2022/mar/10/facebook-posts/yes-oil-companies-are-reporting-record-breaking-pr/;U.S. gas prices
column2: which were already on the rise following pandemic-related changes in supply and demand
column3: hit a new price per gallon high March 8 that hasn’t been seen since July 2008.

column1: The price increase was partly attributed to the invasion of Ukraine as Western countries imposed economic sanctions on Russia for its aggression.
Several major oil companies — Exxon
column2: Chevron
column3: BP and Shell — reported record-breaking profits before the invasion.

column1: 2;37;March 9, 2022;mostly-true; The oil industry has 9,000 permits to drill now. They could be drilling right now, yesterday, last week, last year. ;['National', 'Energy', 'Gas Prices', 'Foreign Policy', 'Russia', 'Joe Biden'];https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2022/mar/09/joe-biden/fact-checking-bidens-claim-there-are-9000-unused-o/;President Joe Biden announced on March 8 a ban of all imports of Russian oil and gas and energy in response to Russia’s attack on Ukraine.
At the end of 2021
column2: there were about 9
column3: 000 approved permits to drill on federal and Indian lands. Those permits included those issued under Biden and those still active from Trump’s administration.

column1: Before drilling
column2: companies assess whether it makes economic sense to drill immediately or wait.

column1: 3;63;April 20, 2022;half-true; Joe Biden s spending has sent prices skyrocketing. ;['Ohio', 'Corrections and Updates', 'Economy', 'Food', 'Gas Prices', 'Stimulus', 'Coronavirus', 'Ukraine', 'Jane Timken'];https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2022/apr/20/jane-timken/bidens-american-rescue-plan-fueled-inflation-so-di/;Inflation in March was 8.5%
column2: a 40-year high. The $1.9 trillion American Rescue Plan helped fuel about half or less of the increase
column3: analysts say.

column1: Other causes of inflation include COVID-19’s impact on labor markets and supply chains. Higher energy prices also would have triggered high inflation even without the American Rescue Plan.
Russia’s war in Ukraine has made a challenging situation worse.

4;74;March 28, 2022;half-true; The United Nations sent out an email instructing staff not to use the words invasion or war’ when referring to Ukraine. ;['National', 'Facebook Fact-checks', 'Ukraine', 'Facebook posts'];https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2022/mar/28/facebook-posts/claim-un-told-staff-not-use-war-invasion-describe-/;An email was sent on March 7 instructing some U.N. staff members not to use the words “war” or “invasion” when discussing the conflict between Russia and Ukraine.
The message came from a regional office without clearance and is not considered official U.N. policy
column2: organization officials told PolitiFact. U.N. leaders including Secretary General António Guterres and Rosemary DiCarlo
column3: the organization’s under-secretary-general for political and peacebuilding affairs
column4: used the words in tweets before and after the email was sent.

column1: 5;78;March 16, 2022;half-true; Wladimir Klitschko has auctioned off his 1996 Atlanta Olympic Games gold medal to raise money for the children of Ukraine. ;['Foreign Policy', 'Sports', 'Facebook Fact-checks', 'Ukraine', 'Russia', 'Facebook posts'];https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2022/mar/16/facebook-posts/ukrainian-boxing-star-auctioned-olympic-gold-medal/;In 2012
column2: Ukrainian former professional boxer Wladimir Klitschko auctioned off the Olympic gold medal he won in 1996
column3: raising $1 million for Ukrainian children.

column1: In March 2022
column2: Facebook users circulated a post that recounted Klitschko’s gesture without specifying that it took place over a decade earlier. The post left the misleading impression that Klitschko sold the medal amid Russia’s ongoing invasion of Ukraine.

column1: 6;83;March 4, 2022;half-true; Joe Biden s sanctions on Russia are riddled with loopholes and don t even start for 30 days. They have carve outs for the energy and financial sectors. ;['Ohio', 'Energy', 'Foreign Policy', 'Trade', 'Ad Watch', 'Ukraine', 'Russia', 'Mike Gibbons'];https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2022/mar/04/mike-gibbons/fact-checking-whether-bidens-russia-sanctions-over/;Some of the U.S. sanctions against Russia took immediate effect
column2: while some were phased in over 30 days.

column1: The energy sector was largely spared
column2: but banks were targeted directly.

column1: 7;86;February 28, 2022;half-true; The Keystone XL pipeline would have produced 830,000 barrels of oil per day, more than enough to offset what we import from Russia. ;['Energy', 'Trade', 'Ad Watch', 'Russia', 'Jake LaTurner'];https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2022/feb/28/jake-laturner/keystone-wouldnt-simply-offset-oil-us-imports-russ/;The Keystone pipeline
column2: which President Joe Biden canceled
column3: would have transported more oil per day than the U.S. imports from Russia
column4: but it would not have been a simple offset.

column1: The pipeline would have required years of construction and likely faced legal challenges
column2: so it couldn’t have solved today’s demand needs.

column1: There would have been no certainty that the pipeline could have produced a net increase of 800
column2: 000 barrels a day
column3: rather than just transporting oil from Canada that is currently being transported some other way.

column1: Producers would not have been obligated to sell that entire amount to the U.S.

8;87;February 25, 2022;half-true; Photos show Ukrainian Christians pray outdoors, in the snow, for their country in this phase of war danger. ;['Religion', 'Facebook Fact-checks', 'Ukraine', 'Russia', 'Facebook posts'];https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2022/feb/25/facebook-posts/photos-ukrainians-praying-phase-war-danger-are-act/; The photos do show Ukrainians in prayer

column3: the other in 2019.

column1: 9;98;March 29, 2022;barely-true; The Space Foundation has erased the honors previously bestowed on Yuri Gagarin, the first man to ever be in space. His name was stripped ‘in light of current events.’ ;['National', 'Space', 'Facebook Fact-checks', 'Ukraine', 'Facebook posts'];https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2022/mar/29/facebook-posts/space-foundation-didnt-revoke-honors-russian-cosmo/;The Space Foundation removed Yuri Gagarin’s name from an upcoming fundraising event after it received derogatory and anti-Russia comments on its social media accounts.
The organization did not revoke any formal honors from the cosmonaut. Exhibits related to Gagarin are still on display at the foundation’s gallery in Colorado
column2: and his accomplishments will still be celebrated at the annual event
column3: the group said.

column1: 11;113;March 10, 2022;barely-true; Donald Trump s appeasement of Putin wasn t just a personal act of treason, it s the Republican Party s official position. ;['Legal Issues', 'Foreign Policy', 'Patriotism', 'Ad Watch', 'Ukraine', 'Russia', 'VoteVets'];https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2022/mar/10/votevets/trump-acts-not-treason-and-gop-platform-reducing-u/;Donald Trump’s actions regarding Ukraine led to his impeachment but did not rise to the level of treason
column2: which is defined in the U.S. Constitution.

column1: This claim from a veterans advocacy group refers to a wording change in the Republican Party platform that pertains to arming Ukraine in its fight against Russia.
But the platform does not amount to an official policy of appeasing Russian President Vladimir Putin
column2: as it still contains language about assisting Ukraine and warning Russia about aggression against Ukraine or other nations.

column1: 12;123;April 22, 2022;false; America (is) trying to overthrow the Ukraine government just as the shadow government has infiltrated and overthrown the US government. ;['Facebook Fact-checks', 'Ukraine', 'Facebook posts'];https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2022/apr/22/facebook-posts/us-not-orchestrating-takeover-ukraine/; The U.S. has provided more financial
column2: humanitarian and military support to Ukraine than any other nation since the outbreak of war
column3: according to the Kiel Institute for the World Economy’s Ukraine Support Tracker.

column1: The U.S. has not sent combat troops to Ukraine.
There is no evidence to support the claim that a shadow government has infiltrated and overthrown the U.S. government.

13;126;April 20, 2022;false; Vladimir Putin ended the Rothschild s control over Russia nationalizing the Russian centralized bank. ;['Foreign Policy', 'Facebook Fact-checks', 'Ukraine', 'Russia', 'Facebook posts'];https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2022/apr/20/facebook-posts/putin-did-not-nationalize-russian-central-bank-and/; Russian President Vladimir Putin was not responsible for the nationalization of the Russian centralized bank
column2: which took place in 1917.

column1: The Rothschild family banking business has had an office in Russia since the 1990s
column2: but it has no oversight over the country’s currency or monetary policies
column3: which are controlled by the Bank of Russia.

column1: The Rothschild family long has been the target of conspiracy theories
column2: and their wealth is believed to be responsible for inspiring the anti-Semitic trope that Jewish people “control” the world’s money.

column1: 14;127;April 20, 2022;false; After Russia invaded Ukraine, Google Maps opened all military and strategic facilities in Russia. ;['Technology', 'Facebook Fact-checks', 'Ukraine', 'Russia', 'Facebook posts'];https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2022/apr/20/facebook-posts/google-maps-did-not-change-blurring-settings-revea/; Google told PolitiFact that it has not made any “blurring changes” to its satellite images of Russia.
Some of the Russian facilities that social media users claim are now suddenly visible have been available in high resolution on Google platforms for years.

15;133;April 18, 2022;false; Ukraine was responsible for the Kramatorsk train station bombing. ;['National', 'Facebook Fact-checks', 'Ukraine', 'Russia', 'Facebook posts'];https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2022/apr/18/facebook-posts/no-evidence-ukraine-attacked-train-station-one-its/;There’s no credible evidence that Ukraine was behind the April 8 attack at the Kramatorsk train station. A video used to bolster this claim is fake — it did not come from the BBC.
The claim has largely been spread by pro-Kremlin accounts following reports of civilian casualties and contradict earlier Russian posts that initially took credit for the bombing.
The Tochka-U missile used in the attack
column2: and the serial number on it
column3: isn’t proof that it came from the Ukrainian army. Several news reports
column4: legitimate photos and videos show that Russia has used these missile systems recently.

column1: 16;147;March 22, 2022;pants-fire; The Russian airstrike on a maternity hospital in Mariupol, Ukraine, had the makings of yet another false flag operation led the U.S. ;['Foreign Policy', 'Pundits', 'Facebook Fact-checks', 'PunditFact', 'Ukraine', 'Russia', 'Pearson Sharp'];https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2022/mar/22/pearson-sharp/one-america-news-runs-conspiratorial-segment-claim/;The aftermath of the attack on a maternity hospital in Mariupol
column2: Ukraine
column3: was captured on video and in photos showing that it was an actual attack.

column1: A Pentagon spokesperson called OAN host Pearson Sharp’s claims “ridiculous.” Several independent experts who spoke to PolitiFact agreed that it was completely without merit. Russian officials have conceded the attack occurred.

17;149;March 18, 2022;pants-fire; What is happening here is not so different from what we re seeing happening in Russia, where you have got state TV and controlled messaging across the board. ;['National', 'Pundits', 'Technology', 'PunditFact', 'Ukraine', 'Russia', 'Tulsi Gabbard'];https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2022/mar/18/tulsi-gabbard/tulsi-gabbard-falsely-claims-us-not-so-different-r/;Since its invasion of Ukraine
column2: Russia has restricted dissenting voices
column3: independent news reporting and public discourse on social media platforms.

There are no parallels in the U.S.
column2: where freedom of speech
column3: expression and the press are safeguarded by the Constitution. Gabbard alleged censorship by social media companies
column4: but experts say those claims are not supported by evidence.

column1: 18;238;March 7, 2022;barely-true; As the world rallies around Ukraine, Mike Lee was one of only two senators to oppose sanctions on Putin. Then he flew to the Kremlin and discussed dropping sanctions. Lee even opposed arming Ukrainians fighting for their lives. ;['Foreign Policy', 'Ad Watch', 'Ukraine', 'Russia', 'Evan McMullin'];https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2022/mar/07/evan-mcmullin/evan-mcmullin-ad-portraying-gop-utah-sen-mike-lee-/;The ad mixes present events
column2: referring to the recent Russian invasion of Ukraine
column3: with actions Lee took years ago.

column1: Lee voted in 2017 against sanctions against Russia.
The ad is misleading in saying Lee’s votes over several years against large spending bills were evidence that he specifically opposed spending provisions in them to aid Ukraine.

19;242;March 3, 2022;barely-true; NEW: Biden Admin. instructs Americans to social distance and wear masks in the event of a Nuclear Fallout. ;['Nuclear', 'Facebook Fact-checks', 'Coronavirus', 'Ukraine', 'Russia', 'Facebook posts'];https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2022/mar/03/facebook-posts/fema-added-covid-19-safety-measures-nuclear-explos/;The website Ready.gov provides information on preparing for
column2: responding to and mitigating emergencies. One page on the site provides safety guidelines
column3: including social distancing and mask wearing
column4: in the event of a nuclear explosion.

column1: The Federal Emergency Management Agency said the language is not “new
column2: ” nor is it related to the Russia-Ukraine conflict. The language on distancing and masking was added during the first year of the COVID-19 pandemic.

column1: 20;243;February 28, 2022;barely-true; We have doubled our (oil) imports from Russia in the last year. ;['Energy', 'Foreign Policy', 'Pundits', 'PunditFact', 'Russia', 'Maria Bartiromo'];https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2022/feb/28/maria-bartiromo/us-did-not-double-oil-imports-russia-last-year/;The most recent data from the U.S. Energy Information Administration shows that the U.S. increased its oil imports from Russia by about 28% in the first 11 months of 2021.
The U.S. did double the amount of crude oil imported from Russia last year. But Russia accounts for only about 3% of overall U.S. crude oil imports in 2021.

21;244;February 28, 2022;barely-true; The United States buys 206,000 barrels of oil a day from Russia but shut down domestic oil production a year ago. ;['Energy', 'Facebook Fact-checks', 'Russia', 'Facebook posts'];https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2022/feb/28/facebook-posts/no-us-did-not-end-its-domestic-oil-production-it-d/;The U.S. imports oil from about 80 countries.
The federal government never ended domestic oil production in the U.S.

22;245;February 28, 2022;barely-true; NATO (under direction from the United States) is violating previous agreements and expanding eastward. ;['History', 'Foreign Policy', 'Pundits', 'PunditFact', 'Ukraine', 'Russia', 'Candace Owens'];https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2022/feb/28/candace-owens/fact-checking-claims-nato-us-broke-agreement-again/;No legal agreement prohibits NATO from expanding eastward.

Russians have argued that comments made by U.S. and other Western leaders during the negotiations over the reunification of Germany constituted a promise that NATO would not extend beyond then-East Germany. Those allegations have sparked decades of debate amongst those involved in the events
column2: and scholars studying them.

column1: Even scholars who say they believe western powers did offer the Soviet Union assurances about NATO expansion say Owens’ claim is misleading.

23;275;April 12, 2022;false; Poland palace that Biden visited is fake. ;['Corrections and Updates', 'Foreign Policy', 'Facebook Fact-checks', 'Ukraine', 'Russia', 'Facebook posts'];https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2022/apr/12/facebook-posts/no-bidens-trip-poland-wasnt-staged/;Multiple photographs
column2: videos and news articles show that President Joe Biden visited the Presidential Palace in Warsaw on March 26
column3: where he met with President Andrzej Duda.

column1: While there appears to be something covering the exterior of the building at the entrance
column2: wider shots show the entirety of the building and courtyard. Duda’s office confirmed renovation work on the palace has begun.

column1: Biden was also photographed and recorded during a visit with U.S. troops on March 25 and giving a speech on March 26.

24;287;April 7, 2022;false; Photo of injured Ukrainian woman was from 2018 Russia gas explosion. ;['Facebook Fact-checks', 'Ukraine', 'Russia', 'Instagram posts'];https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2022/apr/07/instagram-posts/iconic-photo-ukraine-war-not-russia-gas-explosion/;Olena Kurilo
column2: a teacher
column3: was injured on Feb. 24
column5: when a Russian missile strike hit her apartment complex in Chuhuiv

Photos in news reports that day show the apartment complex is not the building damaged by a 2018 gas explosion in Russia.

25;291;March 3, 2022;pants-fire; The Russian army does not occupy Ukrainian territory. ;['Foreign Policy', 'Military', 'Ukraine', 'Russia', 'Russian Embassy in Canada'];https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2022/mar/03/russian-embassy-canada/russias-pants-fire-claim-it-not-occupying-ukrainia/; Not only does independent reporting find this notion to be wrong

column1: 26;293;March 1, 2022;pants-fire; Ukrainian fighter-ace known as the Ghost of Kyiv s real name is Samuyil Hyde. ;['Facebook Fact-checks', 'Ukraine', 'Russia', 'Facebook posts'];https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2022/mar/01/facebook-posts/samuyil-hyde-internet-meme-not-ghost-kyiv-pilot/;Sam Hyde is a comedian whose name has been used as an online meme since 2015

If the pilot does exist

column1: 27;294;February 21, 2022;pants-fire; Says Joe Biden risks war with Russia because Vladimir Putin doesn’t believe in transgender rights. ;['National', 'Ohio', 'Corrections and Updates', 'Foreign Policy', 'Military', 'Sexuality', 'Ukraine', 'Russia', 'J.D. Vance'];https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2022/feb/21/jd-vance/jd-vance-says-transgender-rights-drives-looming-co/;Ohio Senate candidate JD Vance said the State Department’s focus on transgender rights is inflaming the conflict with Russia in Ukraine.
Russia has placed as many as 150
column2: 000 troops near Ukraine’s borders.

column1: Russia has said Ukraine’s ties to NATO are a key threat to Russia’s national security.

28;295;February 21, 2022;pants-fire; Russia has never attacked anyone throughout its history. ;['History', 'Foreign Policy', 'Military', 'Ukraine', 'Russia', 'Dmitry Peskov'];https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2022/feb/21/dmitry-peskov/russian-spokesmans-statement-ignores-centuries-rus/; Historians cite upwards of a dozen examples dating back to the 1500s in which Russia or the Soviet Union attacked another country without being militarily attacked first.
Russia may offer various justifications for why it attacked another country in these instances
column2: but each of these examples involved militarily unprovoked actions by Russia or the Soviet Union.

column1: 29;422;April 4, 2022;false; A video taken from a car driving through Bucha, Ukraine, shows a corpse moving his arm, and then in the rear view mirror the ‘corpse’ sits down. ;['National', 'Military', 'Facebook Fact-checks', 'Ukraine', 'Russia', 'Russian Ministry of Defense'];https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2022/apr/04/russian-ministry-defense/russia-pushes-false-crisis-actor-claims-about-vide/;The Russian Ministry of Defense and other top Russian officials claimed that a video of a car driving through Ukraine showed two crisis actors playing the role of dead Ukrainians in a staged massacre. On Telegram and Twitter
column2: they claimed that the video showed one person moving their arm
column3: and another person seen in the car’s mirror sitting up.

column1: The video does not show a person raising an arm as the car drives by; it shows a mark floating across the car’s windshield — perhaps a drop of water or a speck of dirt.
The video does not show someone sitting up after the car drives by; it shows a stationary corpse through the lens of the car’s passenger-side mirror
column2: which has distorting effects.

column1: 30;562;March 25, 2022;false; Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky wore a Nazi cross symbol. ;['National', 'Facebook Fact-checks', 'Ukraine', 'Russia', 'Facebook posts'];https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2022/mar/25/facebook-posts/zelenskys-shirt-bears-emblem-ukraine-armed-forces-/;An Iron Cross visible on some of Zelensky’s military green T-shirts is not a Nazi symbol. It represents the official emblem of Ukraine’s armed forces and includes the country’s coat of arms in the center.
The Iron Cross is a commonly used
column2: famous German military medal. It’s not a hate symbol on its own. It was turned into a Nazi symbol when the regime superimposed a swastika in the center.

column1: 31;566;March 23, 2022;false; Video shows Russian soldiers using weapons that have been in a cupboard since Soviet times. ;['Facebook Fact-checks', 'Ukraine', 'Russia', 'Facebook posts'];https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2022/mar/23/facebook-posts/video-appears-show-kenyan-soldiers-not-russians/;The soldiers seen in the video don’t appear to be wearing Russian uniforms
column2: an expert on land warfare said.

column1: The uniforms appear to match those worn by soldiers in the Kenya Defence Forces.
A longer version of the video says the soldiers are members of the Kenyan military.

32;569;March 18, 2022;false; Putin Vows to ‘Crush’ Child Traffickers in Ukraine ;['Facebook Fact-checks', 'Ukraine', 'Russia', 'Facebook posts'];https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2022/mar/18/facebook-posts/there-no-evidence-putin-invaded-ukraine-fight-chil/; This claim originated in an article published by a website known for sharing misinformation
column2: including one previous false claim on Ukraine.

column1: Russia’s president stated many reasons for the invasion. Ending child trafficking was not among them.

column2: Russia is failing to deal with human trafficking within its own borders.

column1: 33;570;March 17, 2022;false; A recent on-air protest can’t be real because there are no live on air television broadcasts in Russia. None. Ever. ;['Facebook Fact-checks', 'Ukraine', 'Russia', 'Facebook posts'];https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2022/mar/17/facebook-posts/news-and-other-programs-are-broadcast-live-russian/;An employee at state-owned Channel One in Russia recently interrupted a live news broadcast to protest the war in Ukraine.
Multiple experts say there are live news broadcasts and other live events on Russian TV.
A former employee of the station said that all Channel One news is live. An expert we spoke with said that’s because of the country’s many time zones.

34;572;March 17, 2022;false; Comparing the price of oil and gas in June 2008 to March 2022 shows that oil companies are price gouging. ;['National', 'Economy', 'Energy', 'Gas Prices', 'Russia', 'Facebook posts'];https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2022/mar/17/facebook-posts/persistent-high-gas-prices-dont-prove-price-gougin/;Experts who study the price of oil and gas said it can take weeks for gasoline prices to respond to changes in crude oil costs.

column2: an economic recession caused a supply shortage that drove up oil and gas prices.

column1: Currently
column2: Russia’s invasion of Ukraine
column3: increased labor costs
column4: the pandemic and additional taxes and inflation have all contributed to rising gasoline prices. The same factors weren’t at play in 2008

column1: 35;574;March 17, 2022;false; A West Virginia inspection sticker on an Uber proves the car was not in Ukraine. ;['West Virginia', 'National', 'Facebook Fact-checks', 'Ukraine', 'Facebook posts'];https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2022/mar/17/facebook-posts/news-video-shot-car-was-filmed-ukraine-not-west-vi/;A West Virginia State Police captain confirmed that the Uber’s window decal was an expired inspection sticker from the state. But that doesn’t mean that the car itself wasn’t in Ukraine.
The video showing the car was recorded in Irpin

column3: according to Reuters

column2: including Ukraine.

column1: 36;702;March 14, 2022;false; Classified documents from Ukraine confirm without a shadow of a doubt that the Ukraine government was covertly preparing an offensive operation against Donbas, scheduled for March 2022. ;['National', 'Military', 'Ukraine', 'Russia', 'Tweets'];https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2022/mar/14/tweets/no-document-doesnt-show-secret-ukrainian-military-/;The document isn’t classified

column2: 'Ukraine'

column1: 38;706;March 11, 2022;false; Joe Biden s cancellation of the Keystone pipeline dramatically increased Americans dependence on Russian oil. ;['Energy', 'Trade', 'Ad Watch', 'Russia', 'Mike Pence'];https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2022/mar/11/mike-pence/mike-pences-group-falsely-blames-bidens-nixing-key/;The Keystone XL pipeline was never built

Now, thanks to Joe Biden, we’re paying $105 a barrel to Russia. ;['National', 'Energy', 'Gas Prices', 'Facebook Fact-checks', 'Russia', 'Facebook posts'];https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2022/mar/10/facebook-posts/social-media-post-drilling-and-cost-russian-oil-mi/;The U.S. was selling its oil for about $27 per barrel — not  drilling for that price
column2: energy experts said. And

column1: Energy analysts said that the notion that the U.S. has been paying $105 per barrel for Russian oil probably isn’t too far off
column2: though it’s hard to pinpoint. In general
column3: prices were going up throughout January and February
column4: so the U.S. was paying more for all oil imports

column1: The current
column2: higher prices are largely attributable to Russia’s war in Ukraine and to a sluggish response to energy demands after the pandemic slowdown.

column1: 41;710;March 9, 2022;false; Gas is high because they shut down production in the U.S. under the Biden administration. ;['Corrections and Updates', 'Energy', 'Gas Prices', 'Facebook Fact-checks', 'Russia', 'Facebook posts'];https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2022/mar/09/facebook-posts/oil-production-bidens-first-year-par-trump/;Gas prices soared to an average $4.173 per gallon on March 8
column2: according to AAA
column3: breaking a 2008 record.

column1: Oil production in the U.S. in President Joe Biden’s first year was on par with 2020 and higher than in two of the four years Trump was president.
Increased consumer demand
column2: inflation and the war in Ukraine are among the factors in the rising price at the pump
column3: experts say.

column1: 42;712;March 7, 2022;false; Ukraine issued a press release about Joe Biden ;['Foreign Policy', 'Ukraine', 'Russia', 'Facebook posts'];https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2022/mar/07/facebook-posts/press-conference-was-held-2020-orchestrated-russia/; The press conference was held in May 2020 and featured a Ukrainian lawmaker
column2: Andrii Derkach
column3: who is described by U.S. officials as an active Russian agent.

column1: Recordings of President Joe Biden that Derkach released corroborate Biden’s description of his dealings in Ukraine.

43;714;March 7, 2022;false; The former Miss Universe-Ukraine, Anastasiia Lenna, turned in her high heels for some combat boots to fight for her country. ;['National', 'Military', 'Facebook Fact-checks', 'Ukraine', 'Russia', 'Facebook posts'];https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2022/mar/07/facebook-posts/no-former-ukrainian-beauty-queen-has-not-joined-uk/;The viral photograph shows Anastasiia Lenna
column2: the 2015 Miss Grand Ukraine winner
column3: posing with an airsoft gun. She confirmed that she did not join the Ukrainian military and said she posted the staged image to inspire people.

column1: 44;834;March 4, 2022;false; Image shows Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky has joined the front lines with his troops. ;['Facebook Fact-checks', 'Ukraine', 'Russia', 'Facebook posts'];https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2022/mar/04/facebook-posts/ukrainian-president-not-frontline-military/; A photo of Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky dressed in military fatigues is from 2021.

45;836;March 2, 2022;false; Photos show Ukrainian citizens destroying two Russian tanks with Molotov cocktails in Kyiv. ;['Facebook Fact-checks', 'Ukraine', 'Russia', 'Facebook posts'];https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2022/mar/02/facebook-posts/these-photos-molotov-cocktails-are-2014-protests-k/;Four photos showing scenes of fire
column2: billowing smoke and people engaged in a fight date back to 2014 anti-government protests in Ukraine.

column1: 46;839;February 28, 2022;false; A photo showing young children saluting troops was captured in Ukraine in 2022. ;['Foreign Policy', 'Facebook Fact-checks', 'Ukraine', 'Russia', 'Viral image'];https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2022/feb/28/viral-image/photo-children-sending-ukrainian-troops-2016-not-2/;The viral image of children waving off troops dates back to 2016. It does not depict the current conflict between Ukraine and Russia.

47;841;February 28, 2022;false; Actor Steven Seagal spotted among Russian special forces in Ukraine ;['Facebook Fact-checks', 'Ukraine', 'Russia', 'Joe Rogan'];https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2022/feb/28/joe-rogan/action-star-steven-seagal-friend-putin-not-soldier/;Podcaster Joe Rogan posted a fake CNN story that said action star Steven Seagal was spotted among Russian special forces in Ukraine. He later deleted the post
column2: he said
column3: because it was a “parody.”

column1: CNN confirmed that the post purporting to be from its Twitter account was fake.
Seagal does have a friendship with Russian President Vladimir Putin
column2: who granted him citizenship in 2016
column3: and Seagal was once banned from Ukraine as a “national security threat.”

column1: 48;846;February 25, 2022;false; Russia is targeting U.S. biological weapons labs in Ukraine invasion. ;['Facebook Fact-checks', 'Ukraine', 'Russia', 'Tweets'];https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2022/feb/25/tweets/there-are-no-us-run-biolabs-ukraine-contrary-socia/;There are no U.S.-run biological weapons labs operating in Ukraine.
The U.S. Defense Department and the Ukraine Ministry of Health have had a partnership since 2005 to improve public health laboratories and prevent the threat of outbreaks of infectious diseases.
That effort is part of the Cooperative Threat Reduction Program
column2: which began in 1991 to reduce the threat of existing weapons of mass destruction programs in former Soviet Republics.

column1: 49;847;February 25, 2022;false; Ethnic Russians face genocide perpetrated the Kyiv regime. ;['National', 'Human Rights', 'Crime', 'Foreign Policy', 'Military', 'Ukraine', 'Russia', 'Vladimir Putin'];https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2022/feb/25/vladimir-putin/putin-repeats-long-running-claim-genocide-ukraine/;Despite multiple claims of a Ukrainian genocide against ethnic Russians
column2: there is no evidence to support it.

column1: International bodies that include Russian representatives report that civilian deaths have plummeted since 2014.
Russia’s ambassador to the U.S. relied on misleading and outdated evidence to back the claim.

50;979;February 22, 2022;false; Ukraine was the No. 1 donor to Hillary Clinton when she was running for president. ;['Georgia', 'National', 'Campaign Finance', 'Foreign Policy', 'Ukraine', 'Marjorie Taylor Greene'];https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2022/feb/22/marjorie-taylor-greene/marjorie-taylor-greene-falsely-claims-ukraine-was-/;Hillary Clinton’s 2016 presidential campaign did not report receiving any donations from the Ukrainian government or Ukrainian nationals. Those donations would have been illegal.

A spokesperson for Marjorie Taylor Greene cited a 2015 Wall Street Journal graphic that has been frequently misrepresented online. The chart shows donations to the Clinton Foundation between 1999 and 2014 by the nationality of the individuals who made them; it does not say anything about donations to the foundation by foreign governments.
The Clinton Foundation said it has never received donations from Ukraine’s government.
